title: Modified Boxplot
question_text: What is the principal difference between a modified boxplot and a regular boxplot?

choices.text: A modified boxplot has a different shape than a regular boxplot.
A modified boxplot has whiskers that extend to the largest and smallest points that are not outliers, and outliers are plotted separately.
A modified boxplot has whiskers that extend to the largest and smallest points.

A modified boxplot has whiskers that extend to the outlier cutoffs:
Third Quartile+1.5(IQR) and First Quartileâˆ’1.5(IQR)
Outliers are not plotted.
A modified boxplot has a larger standard deviation than a regular boxplot.
